cell.paragraph: Compiling is the process of building a project into an executable file which may be then executed externally to ENViSioN!. To compile a project, select Build Solution from the Build menu as demonstrated below:
There are eight entries on the Build menu, each described below:

list.item: Build Solution - Compiles the current solution. All projects in the current solution will be built. This process attempts to minimize the compilation that must be undertaken, by only re-compiling files that have been modified.

Rebuild Solution - Compiles the current solution from scratch. All projects in the current solution will be built. There is no optimization of which files will be compiled, and it is equivalent to compiling a project for the very first time.
Clean Solution - Deletes all built/compiled outputs from the Solution.

Build Selection - Compiles only the currently selected project in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/20_Solution_Explorer/index.htm Solution Explorer . The compilation method of this project is equivalent to that performed by Build Solution. This menu entry is greyed out when there is no project selected in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/20_Solution_Explorer/index.htm Solution Explorer .

Rebuild Selection - Compiles only the currently selected project in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/20_Solution_Explorer/index.htm Solution Explorer .The compilation method of this project is equivalent to that performed by Rebuild Solution. This menu entry is greyed out when there is no project selected in the
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/20_Solution_Explorer/index.htm Solution Explorer .
Clean Selection - Removes all built/compiled outputs from the selected project.
Batch Build... - Displays a dialog allowing you to specify which Projects are to be compiled. This allows you to compile selected projects within the current Solution.
Configuration Manager... - Displays a dialog allowing you to specify Project configuration information for each Project in the Solution.

cell.paragraph:
The
/10_Developing/20_Managing_Projects/10_Configuring_A_Project/10_Project_Property_Pages/ProjectConfiguration.htm Project Property Pages allow you to adjust the properties of your project, many of which apply directly to the compilation.

If your compilation fails, see
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/60_Compiling_Projects/CompilationErrors.htm Compilation Errors for more information on correcting such errors.
